headline: Sugar-Free "Sugar" Cookies with Sugar-Free "Sugar" Icing
description: These cookies don't have to be a guilty pleasure!
name: Sugar-Free "Sugar" Cookies with Sugar-Free "Sugar" Icing
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup Pyure Organic All Purpose Stevia Blend
3 tablespoons Pyure Organic All Purpose Stevia Blend

recipeInstructions.text: Beat butter with Pyure Organic All Purpose Stevia Blend until light and fluffy.
Beat in egg until well blended. Beat in vanilla.
Whisk flour, baking powder and salt together. Stir into butter mixture in two additions.
Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Roll on lightly floured surface or between sheets of waxed paper to 1/4-inch thick.
Using desired cookie cutter, cut out desired shapes.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place cookies 2-inches apart on parchment paper lined baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden. Let cool on racks.
Glaze cookies with Pyure Sugar Free Cookie Icing.
Icing Directions: Beat cornstarch, Pyure Organic All Purpose Stevia Blend and butter with a mixer on medium-high speed until well combined.
Gradually add milk and vanilla until smooth. Add more milk if icing mixture is too dry.
If adding food coloring, add a drop at a time until desired color is reached.
Refrigerate icing for 10 minutes until set.
Spread or pipe over cooled Sugar Free "Sugar" Cookies. Use day of.

review.reviewBody: Cookies were OK, not bad for sugar free. The dough is sticky, so definitely refrigerate longer than the 30 minutes suggested in the recipe. The icing though? DO NOT BOTHER. Trust me. Pyure is WAY too expensive to waste on a recipe that doesn't work. It doesn't come together - it's loose and chunky. (Edited to add: the recipe might be missing vital instructions - I was able to salvage the icing by throwing it in a saucepan over med-low heat and whisking constantly - sort of like a gravy)
Essentially this is a very bland biscuit with some icing on it. Please find a different cookie recipe to try.
I could not believe the taste of the cookies. I have tried other cookies using Stevia and have not come out as tasty as these cookies. Definitely making these cookies again.
The cookies were dry and the frosting had a strange texture and was terrible

For a sugar-free sugar cookie, this really wasn’t bad. The dough was a little sticky even after the 30 minutes so I put it back in. After around 1 1/2 hours, the dough was perfect. While baking, the cookies didn’t spread too much outward but puffed up a good amount. Taste-wise, they are pretty plain and definitely need frosting or icing of some sort. Overall, I’d recommend to anyone looking for a guilt free treat.

Excellent. Shortbread sort of taste and very light sweetness. Like a Bisquick biscuit almost.
I used Kroger Apriva sweetener and didn't make the frosting. This was just one of a handful of sugar free recipes I have made, so making frosting was not on the agenda.
These took another 3-4 minutes to get to the golden brown stage in my electric oven.
The cookies keeps falling apart and the icing is nasty. The cookies are so cromablly you can't even pick them up and get them to your mouth.!

Loved these! Used honey (same measurements) instead of stevia and added 1/2tsp of lemon extract to sweeten it a little more! Also made a 2nd batch with chocolate chips and was awesome! My husband (who is a sugar cookie fanatic) loved them as did my daughter!!!! 

We didn't make the icing. Instead I blended cream cheese and fresh fruit with 1 tsp of vanilla extract. Wasnt ideal to let sit on the cookies but great to dip!

I really liked this recipe. My niece has GSD type 2 and she can have like no sugar. I did replace the stevia with Splenda but otherwise made it as per instructions. They were a hit at the kids birthday party. The kids got to ice them and enjoyed every bite. They didn’t know they were sugar free.
the cookies were great! pretty sweet, but really good. the icing, in the other hand was a weird, gloppy, stretchy consistency, and tasted like oobleck.

I followed the recipe exactly and I have a few tips for anyone looking to make this:
- Instead of using 1/4 cup of Stevia, I would actually double that and use 1/2 cup. The cookies are pretty good, they just need to be a lot sweeter. I fixed this by using some packaged icing (not sugar free, so this isn't an option for everyone). 
- I would suggest buying/making your own icing to put on top to add a little more flavor.
The consistency of th e icing was a little weird, but tasted great once it was on the cookie!
Keto Approved! My family and I loved these Sugar-Free Cookies! Guilt-free Indulgence. Just in time for the holidays!
I can't have sugar and it was good
Got excited with sugarless cookies but I need glutten free too so doesn't help me I mark not those ingredients in my search
The cookies were flavorless! They needed to be a little sweeter. I was not a fan of the icing because it tasted just like cornstarch!
Cookies turned out okay but are a little bit dry if the recipe is followed and definitely could have used an actual icing on top. The icing recipe did not work for me at all.
